column1: Many smaller European towns and cities are named after their founders
column2: often dating back many hundreds of years. Often
column3: there is not much known about them today. In Europe and South America
column4: it is common practice to name (and often rename) birthplace towns for political leaders or distinguished figures. There are other cases of this phenomenon present across the continents
column5: especially in regions dominated by a hegemonic political ideology
